name: Onyx Sleet TTPs
description: TTPs identified in Onyx Sleet's Operation Blacksmith

techniques.comment: Used TeamCity CVE-2023-42793 vulnerability for targeted attack leading to remote code execution and administrative control of the server.
Developed new variants of custom RATs for continued access and control. Utilized leased virtual private servers (VPS) and compromised cloud infrastructure for command-and-control.
Employed a previously unseen malware family (Dora RAT) to deliver and execute commands on target service.
Developed and used a spectrum of tools that range from custom to open source.
Example of TTP is the Dtrack RAT.
Used payloads signed with an invalid certificate masquerading as legitimate software to evade detection.
Achieved remote access, executed arbitrary commands, got system storage information, performed directory listing, and created/deleted files on the target device.
Stole over 1.2 TB of data from targeted South Korean defense contractors using custom malware (TigerRAT and SmallTiger).
Spear-phishing used as part of compromizing target environments.
Exploited vulnerabilities for gaining initial access.
Heavily used custom encryption and obfuscation algorithms. Used commercial packers like Themida and VMProtect to obfuscate their malware.
